org.formix.btb

Class ConnectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.formix.btb.ConnectionManager

  • public class ConnectionManager
extends Object

    Manages database URLs contained in the database.properties file. It's possible to define more than one database URL in the file or to load connection attributes from another file.

    • database.url=connection string Defines the default connection string. The attribute is required for the connection manager to work properly.
    • database.url.{name}=connection string It's possible to define as many connection strings as you want provided that you specify a different name for each.
    • database.default={name} If you want another connection string to be used by default, specify it's name with this attribute. Note that the database.url. part is omitted.

    You can change the path of the database.properties file by setting the system property attribute "databases.properties.path" to the desired file path.

    Author:
    Jean-Philippe Gravel

    • Method Detail

      • loadAttributes

        public void loadAttributes()
                    throws IOException
        Loads the default attribute file as defined by the system property "databases.properties.path". If not defined, uses the default value "databases.xml";
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file does not exist.

      • loadAttributes

        public void loadAttributes(String filePath)
                    throws IOException
        Load the specified attribute file. Can read both XML and former attribute files. Note that a XML file must have the extension ".xml" or ".properties" to be recognized.
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path to the file to load.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file does not exist.

      • saveAttributes

        public void saveAttributes()
                    throws IOException
        Saves the default attribute file as defined by ConnectionManager.FILE_PATH.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem during the save operation.

      • saveAttributes

        public void saveAttributes(String filePath)
                    throws IOException
        Saves the changes to the attribute file specified. Note that a XML file must have the extension ".xml" or ".properties" to be recognized.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the file to be saved.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem during the save operation.
